column4: when I'm in ubuntu, my connection gets used for downloading shit that i don't even know what it is
I don't like stuff downloading without me telling it to!
i'm not sure what I'm referring to
every day it'll query the server (i think 8AM local time) to ask if there are updates available
it's just asking if there are updates, then
the default setting is that if it is told that there are updates, it'll ask you before downloading them

how many repositories do you have enabled? it downloads a list of what packages there are for each repository. if you have fewer repositories (example: if you are not a developer, disable source repositories) it'll take less time
it then compares the list it got to the one it already had to see if anything changed
kubuntu didnt exist at first, that's why ubuntu doesnt have the g
when you want to force it to check, you can do that in system -> administration -> software updates. i recommend doing that at least once a week, just to be safe with regard to security
ubuntu was the original, then kubuntu was a community project that canonical decided to hire Riddell to work on. they didnt want to change Ubuntu's name later
its not open source but it can do more complex rars
Package unrar-nonfree is not available, but is referred to by another package.
enabe multiverse in your software sources
